verses.roman:
uddhavaḥ sātyakiś caiva
vyajane paramādbhute
vikīryamāṇaḥ kusumai
reje madhu-patiḥ pathi

synonyms: uddhavaḥ—a cousin-brother of Kṛṣṇa's; sātyakiḥ—His driver; ca—and; eva—certainly; vyajane—engaged in fanning; parama-adbhute—decorative; vikīryamāṇaḥ—seated on scattered; kusumaiḥ—flowers all around; reje—commanded; madhu-patiḥ—the master of Madhu (Kṛṣṇa); pathi—on the road.
translation: Uddhava and Sātyaki began to fan the Lord with decorated fans, and the Lord, as the master of Madhu, seated on scattered flowers, commanded them along the road.
